content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Lab (intended) at Position(x=0.5, y=2.5)
• Use-case: To supply Automation Science Packs for research.
• Details: Multiple attempts were made to locate, craft, and place a Lab at this position. However, due to inventory shortages and missing sub-ingredients, no Lab was successfully created on the map.

### Iron Plate Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)
• Use-case: Utilized for smelting iron ore into iron plates.
• Details: The agent interacted with this furnace for resource processing. Note that this furnace was not constructed by the agent but was referenced during iron plate production.

### Copper Plate Furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)
• Use-case: Utilized for smelting copper ore into copper plates.
• Details: The agent accessed this structure to convert copper ore into copper plates. As with the iron furnace, it was pre-existing and not newly created.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Parameter Usage Errors:
  – Avoid supplying unsupported arguments when calling get_entities. In one instance a keyword 'radius' was passed and in another the function was given extra positional arguments. Verify the function’s signature and pass only the accepted arguments.

• Lab Crafting and Placement Failures:
  – Confirm that a Lab item is available in the inventory before attempting placement.
  – Ensure that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, copper-cables, and copper-plates) are available or producible through an established production chain.
  – Guard against iterating over None by validating that functions like get_entities return a proper iterable (or falling back to an empty list).

• Production Pipeline Shortcomings:
  – Prior to crafting complex items like the Lab, verify that ancillary processes (smelting for iron and copper, crafting intermediary parts) have yielded sufficient materials.
  – Address recurring shortages (for example, missing iron-gear-wheels) by ensuring resource conversion steps are completed successfully before reattempting construction.
